a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of the population with access to basic services, World
Data source: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)
Note: Access to clean cooking fuels is important for the reduction of indoor air pollution. Improved sanitation facilities include flush/pour flush,
ventilated improved pit latrine, pit latrine with slab, and composting toilets. Having access to electricity is defined in international statistics as
having an electricity source that can provide very basic lighting, and charge a phone or power a radio for 4 hours per day.
